Package io.github.xrickastley.sevenelements.element

Class Element.ElementSettings

java.lang.Object
io.github.xrickastley.sevenelements.element.Element.ElementSettings
Enclosing class:
Element
private static class Element.ElementSettings extends Object
A class used in creating data for Elements, instead of multiple overloaded constructors.

    • setPriority

      public Element.ElementSettings setPriority(int priority)
      Controls the priority of this element over the others.

      An element's priority dictates when it can be applied, reapplied, reacted with or when it is rendered on top of the entity. Element priority uses natural ordering, also known as ascending order or "least to greatest".

      For more information, you may refer to the methods that use Element priority.
      Parameters:
      priority - The priority of this element.
      See Also:
      • ElementComponent#getPrioritizedElements
      • ElementComponentImpl#triggerReactions
      • ElementComponentImpl#attemptReapply

    • setDecayRate

      public Element.ElementSettings setDecayRate(@NotNull @NotNull Function<ElementalApplication,Number> decayRate)
      Sets the function controlling the decay rate of this element.

      This function must output a number x such that x is the amount of Gauge Units deducted per tick.
      Parameters:
      decayRate - The damage color of the element.

    • canBeAura

      public Element.ElementSettings canBeAura(boolean aura)
      Sets if the element can be an Aura Element.
      Parameters:
      aura - If the element can be an Aura Element.

    • hasAuraTax

      public Element.ElementSettings hasAuraTax(boolean auraTax)
      Sets if the element, when applied as an Aura Element, would have its Gauge Units deducted by the Aura Tax.
      Parameters:
      auraTax - If the element's Gauge Units should be deducted by the Aura Tax.

    • particleRenderer

      public Element.ElementSettings particleRenderer(Element.ParticleRenderer particleRenderer)
      Sets the particle renderer for this Element.

      This renders particles on the entity per tick while the element is applied.
      Parameters:
      particleRenderer - The particle renderer to use.

    • linkToElement

      public Element.ElementSettings linkToElement(Element element)
      Links this element to the provided element.

      Upon linking, gauge reduction not originating from the gauge decay will be "synced" to the gauge units of this element, if it exists.

      Do note that linking isn't a "recursive" operation, i.e. Element A linked to Element B, Element B linked to Element C, reduction on Element A, B and C.

      You may also choose to sync the gauge decay permanently or with a Predicate.
      Parameters:
      element - The Element to link this element to.
      See Also:
      • ElementSettings#linkElement — For linking the specified element to this element.
      • ElementSettings#linkGaugeDecay — For permanent gauge decay linking.
      • ElementSettings#linkGaugeDecayIf — For conditional gauge decay linking.

    • linkElement

      public Element.ElementSettings linkElement(Element element)
      Links the provided element to this element.

      Upon linking, gauge reduction not originating from the gauge decay will be "synced" to the gauge units of the provided element, if it exists.

      Do note that linking isn't a "recursive" operation, i.e. Element A linked to Element B, Element B linked to Element C, reduction on Element A, B and C.

      You may also choose to sync the gauge decay permanently or with a Predicate.
      Parameters:
      element - The Element to link to this element.
      See Also:
      • ElementSettings#linkToElement — For linking this element to the specified element.
      • ElementSettings#linkGaugeDecay — For permanent gauge decay linking.
      • ElementSettings#linkGaugeDecayIf — For conditional gauge decay linking.

    • linkGaugeDecay

      public Element.ElementSettings linkGaugeDecay(boolean link)
      Sets whether the gauge decay is linked to the gauge of this element, or the gauge of the corresponding element, if reverse was true for
      invalid reference 
      ElementSettings#linkedElement
      .
      Parameters:
      link - Whether the gauge decay is also linked.

    • linkGaugeDecayIf

      public Element.ElementSettings linkGaugeDecayIf(Predicate<ElementalApplication> predicate)
      Sets whether, at this instance in time, the gauge decay is linked to the gauge of this element, or the gauge of the corresponding element, if reverse was true for
      invalid reference 
      ElementSettings#linkedElement
      .
      Parameters:
      predicate - A Predicate indicating whether the gauge decay is also linked at this instance in time. The passed ElementalApplication is the one belonging to the linked element, or more formally, the element this element is linked to.
